answerText: Claisen condensation[10] In the Claisen condensation, this ion serves as the nucleophile. This alkene derivative has a hydroxyl group connected to a double bond, but that hydrogen can shift onto the double bond to form a ketone.
heading: DEES |2014 | VCU A-Carleton A | 10 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Two acetyl-CoA molecules are combined in this reaction to form acetoacetyl-CoA, the precursor of HMG-CoA.  [10] Identify this organic condensation reaction where an ester undergoes a nucleophilic acyl substitution to yield a beta-keto ester.
